snippet: A growing family of apartment houses sharing a common surname has sprouted up over the past 10 years, giving the sense of a mini, matchy architectural movement.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column on growing family of small apartment houses that have sprouted up in Brooklyn over the past 10 years; notes that majority of them share certain features, a reddish brick facade, pair of white columns, and balconies that make them appear like cousins.
lead_paragraph: A growing family of apartment houses sharing a common surname has sprouted up over the past 10 years, giving the sense of a mini, matchy architectural movement.

headline.seo: Building Condos in Brooklyn by the Numbers
headline.main: Building Condos by the Numbers, Skipping Some Along the Way
headline.print_headline: Building Condos by the Numbers, Skipping Some Along the Way
